events.message: The policyholder reported a vehicle collision that occurred last night at an intersection, damaging the front bumper and windshield.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after review of the initial report mentioning car damage and collision.
An insurance claims agent has been assigned to handle the case and contact the claimant to gather further details about the vehicle accident.
The claimant received acknowledgement of the claim submission with assurance that the process will begin promptly.
The agent requested photos of the car damage and a copy of the police accident report to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documentation including vehicle images and official police report for the collision incident.
The investigation team commenced applying forensics and verifying accident details against submitted documents and statements.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and all damage verified as consistent with reported collision.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount covering the full cost of repairs to the claimant's vehicle.
The claimant responded positively expressing satisfaction with the speed and clarity of the claims process so far.
After review, the claim was officially approved to proceed with disbursement of funds for vehicle repairs.
The insurance payment was issued to the claimant’s designated bank account, covering the repair costs agreed upon.
The claim case has been closed successfully following confirmation that repair work has been completed to the policyholder’s satisfaction.
